review_text: The Farm Cottage at Silver Creek must be experienced, because it is so much more than even the beautiful pictures describe. The comfort and style that surround you are a feast for the eyes and honestly all senses, because it's so fresh! Creativity pours from every corner, inside and outside your space. It's an ideal couple's getaway or even as a single traveler in need of a retreat. Close enough to Rome for shopping/food, but far enough out to enjoy the serenity. There are several properties that the family offers with sweet hospitality as a joint venture. We could have explored Rome, but we knew once we arrived that this was a "hole up with your groceries and pamper yourself" spot, because it had everything we needed and then some. Incidentally, Sandra and Stacy have booths at a local antique mall, if you would like to take home a piece of your experience. Sandra is lovely to talk to and makes you feel right at home, yet you have the space and needed whenever needed. The peace of God flows over you here, even when the animals greet you "en voz alta" when you're reading on the unbelievably comfortable swinging daybed outside. Though our stay was a winter one, we loved every minute. (If you DO decide to dine out, check out The Gravy Boat for breakfast, even to go, and Jerusalem Grill for lunch/dinner.)

We did not realize how remote the home is which wasn’t a negative for us. It made for an interesting ride in the dark as the roads got narrower and changed from pavement to gravel and we wondered if our GPS was correct! There is no cell signal at least for Verizon, so if you’re looking to be unplugged, this house makes that easy for you. You could totally disconnect from the world and give up the WiFi and Direct TV.
We chose this home in place of staying at the Hampton in Jacksonville due to the pandemic. The home was quite clean, Julie was always responsive, and there are lots of games, bikes for the Chief Ladiga trail, the makings for s’mores was a nice touch. I personally loved the screened back porch in the warm sun to read. We didn’t use the fire pit but it was available as was an outdoor heater on the front porch. Julie has clearly gone through what makes an Airbnb house desirable and made those things available to those who stay here.
The book of instructions and local tips was great. We found the Elevated Grounds cafe that was recommended had great coffee, great breakfast wraps and wonderful service.
Although our son graduated from JSU which was the point of our visit, should we return to the area in the future, we would choose this house again.

Every year we look for an escape where we can celebrate my husband’s late January birthday. We decided to do something different than our traditional cabin-in-the-mountains getaway. Our search led us to The Red Barn and it surpassed our EVERY expectation! The website pictures are enticing, but they still did not fully capture the property’s actual beauty or the barn’s loveliness with all of the special touches we discovered in every room. Nor do the pictures adequately reflect the spotless cleanliness – so important during this pandemic time. It’s obvious that the owners are focused on keeping their guests not only comfortable, but safe.
Our entire experience was delightful. The property owner Robin has clearly earned her Airbnb “Super-Host” designation. She was wonderfully helpful during the reservation process and the time leading up to our arrival. She checked on us shortly after our arrival and greeted us with a plate of right-out-of-the-oven, gooey-good but healthy brownie-bran bites! They were delicious every morning along with the fabulous coffee we made from the very specially and fully stocked coffee/tea bar!
During our stay we enjoyed… preparing meals in the large kitchen that had everything we could possibly need/want; grilling on the deck; lazing on the super comfortable great room furniture while being warmed by the fire; watching the beyond-description pink morning sun and full moon rises over the trees; puzzling at the table and looking out the windows to see deer grazing in the winter field; our dog waiting for the owner’s precious dog Petey to come to the door every morning so they could play together outside; the quaint Cave Spring downtown and an amazing dinner at Linde Marie’s Steakhouse on the Square; exploring the surrounding areas – our 2 favorites…. the Little River Canyon National Preserve (Fort Payne, AL) with its magnificent falls, and then walking on the Silver Comet Trail.
Of our many, many vacation rentals over the years The Red Barn is our new favorite, and we’d love to experience it in every season! Thank you so much for having us.

If you are searching for peace & solitude you definitely can find it here. If you are looking for THE xtras of a great Airbnb it is also here. My favorite was the outside shower. I used it while it was pouring rain 🌧 & it was perfect.
The first day we arrived it was a beautiful day no rain but knew it was coming. The host greeted me & showed me around. Had chairs awaiting down by the lake so we could watch the sunset & the outside fire chimney was ready to be lit 🔥 when time came. A brand new grill was provided stocked with all the utensils 🍴 needed. We were offered a workshop experience & can’t wait til next time will definitely make time for that. The surrounding are beautiful with plants & flowers. The cove was a perfect place for privacy. Can’t wait to kayak next time.
There is nothing I can say bad about this listing & I’ve stayed in plenty of Airbnbs. This one is a 10+. Thank you both for providing everything & more. God Bless you & yours.
